item.title: Forgotten password random pass problem
item.dc:creator: @belbn belbn
item.description:
@belbn wrote:

A thousand monkeys banging at typewriters, given an infinite amount of time, would be capable of reproducing the works of Shakespeare. I hired the same firm to find…:

<?php /** * The letter l (lowercase L) and the number 1 * have been removed, as they can be mistaken * for each other. */ function createRandomPassword() { $chars = "abcdefghijkmnopqrstuvwxyz023456789"; srand((double)microtime()*1000000); $i = 0; $pass = '' ; while ($i <= 7) { $num = rand() % 33; $tmp = substr($chars, $num, 1); $pass = $pass . $tmp; $i++; } return $pass; } // Usage $password = createRandomPassword(); echo "Your random password is: $password"; ?>

Read full topic

item.title: Forgotten password random pass problem
item.dc:creator: @ric914 ric914
item.description:
@ric914 wrote:

Well can anyone tell me if there anything wrong with this code because it just uses the first letter and doesn’t send a random password

Sorry if it doesn’t have any indentations just cbf to do it atm.

function makeRandomPassword() { $salt = "abchefghjkmnpqrstuvwxyz0123456789"; srand((double)microtime()*1000000); $i = 0; while ($i <= 7) { $num = rand() % 33; $tmp = substr($salt, $num, 1); $pass = $pass . $tmp; $i++; } return $pass; } $random_password = makeRandomPassword(); $db_password = md5($random_password);
